title: From conventional to natural medical system - an incredible growth of Homeopathy by 2030
author: Dr Mukesh Batra
description: Digitization and advancement of technology are breaking ground in the healthcare industry in India. There is a crucial need of the hour to build a medical ecosystem of Homeopathic medicines along with conventional and natural...
cleaned_text: of technology are breaking ground in the healthcare industry in India. There is a crucial need of the hour to build a medical ecosystem of Homeopathic medicines along with conventional and natural medicine. The cross-disciplinary learning needs to be provided to the aspirants of medicine to create cutting-edge homeopathy medical care. The Homeopathy Research Institute (HRI) report states that around 10 crore people, the highest number of individuals in India, rely completely on Homeopathy for medical care. Besides this, homeopathy is globally trusted and used by more than 50 crore people. Recently, Dayal Janseva Pratishthan at Vhalshim, Bicholim launched a combined hospital for ayurveda, homeopathy, and allopathy. This will be the first hospital to be established for combined treatment this year. According to the World Health Organisation (WHO), the complementary medical system is the second-largest system of medicine globally. As per the Precedence Research report, the global homeopathic products market size was valued at US$ 6.2 billion in 2020 and is expected to reach over US$ 19.7 billion by 2030, poised to grow at a noteworthy CAGR of 12.3% from 2021 to 2030. Major population of India inclining towards non-invasive homeopathic treatment globally. Homeopathic medicine has shifted the outlook of people around the globe and boosted the business of medicines as it is free from any side effects. Despite all the hurdles the industry faces, homeopathy still endures gaining acceptance by individuals in India. It has lifted their interest in natural medicine which is cost-effective and easily available with lesser side-effect. This shift has changed the holistic approach to homeopathy healthcare treatment. In today's time, the surgical treatment of the disease is very costly, and it may create adverse effects such as skin or hair loss that may arise after the surgical treatment. It may also lead to dizziness, headache, insomnia, and several other ailments. On the other hand, Homeopathy enables the safest treatment of the disease at an affordable cost with no side effects. Homeopathic medicines assist in aiding obesity, diabetes, and reproductive-related problems. A boom is seen in the Homeopathy market, as individuals are spending more on homeopathic medicines for any type of chronic or lifestyle diseases. Individuals are becoming more conscious of conventional chemical-based medicines and they tend to ease their dependency on the allopathic course. People are now aware of chronic conditions which might not respond to allopathic medicines or surgery and are opting for a lengthy homeopathy course to get long-lasting safe treatment. Treatment for gene complications is another key driving growth factor for the industry, as it helps to minimize the risk of getting a medical disorder in the future through homeopathic medical care. The rising provision of the government and the adoption of buying products online has surged the demand for homeopathic medicines and products around the globe. In the Asia Pacific region, India has the fastest growing economy and will significantly contribute towards the growth of the Homeopathy industry and products in forthcoming years.
